column4: how can i stop the two partitions form my master HD from always mounting?
you can modify /etc/fstab from root, and add the ",noauto" option to the lines concerning the partitions you don't want to automount at startup
as i said, paste me a sample fstab line from your fstab, and i'll show you how to modify it
i sen tyou the lines for my hd
see that "gid=46" ? that has to become "gid=46,noauto"
how come i cannot un mount my partitions from hda1?
try sudo umount instead of simply umount
i don't remember your fstab, but if i recall correctly, it classified them by uuid, not device - that means mount /dev/hda1 wont do you no good
safest bet is to mount by mountpoint, which will always be recognized. ie sudo mount /media/hda1, or whatever the mountpoint is
it'll just tell you that it can't find any /dev/hda1 in fstab/mtab
(that is, if your fstab lists devices by UUID, and not by /dev/xyz)
